judgement.reason: antibacterial refers to anything that can inhibit or kill bacteria, while an antibacterial agent specifically refers to a substance or compound that possesses these properties.
Both terms refer to the same concept and are identical in meaning.
antibiotics are a type of antibacterial agent, but not all antibacterial agents are antibiotics. Antibacterial agents can include other types of compounds such as antiseptics and disinfectants.
Both terms are identical in spelling and meaning, referring to an agent that inhibits bacterial growth or kills bacteria.

antibacterial refers to anything that inhibits bacterial growth, while an antibacterial agent is a specific substance or compound that performs this function. Not all antibacterials are agents, as antibacterial can also describe properties or actions.
